revised_title: Shadow Reaction of Diadema Antillarum: Spine Movements and Their Implications
tldr: The study investigates the shadow reaction of Diadema antillarum, focusing on the movement of their spines in response to localized shadows. The direction and constancy of these movements are determined by the positions of the stimulating light, oral pole, and radial nerve. The findings suggest that the radial nerves play a more significant role than simple local reflex centers, resembling a more complex central nervous system.
